error.signature: Init:Error or Init:CrashLoopBackOff — init container failed to complete

verdict.summary: Init container exits with non-zero status. Main containers won't start until all init containers complete successfully.

dead_ends.action: Skip the init container by moving its logic to the main container
dead_ends.why_fails: Init containers exist for a reason — race conditions and dependency ordering break without them

dead_ends.action: Delete and recreate the pod repeatedly
dead_ends.why_fails: Init container will fail again with the same config — underlying issue isn't resolved

workarounds.action: Check init container logs to find the failure reason
workarounds.how: kubectl logs <pod> -c <init-container-name> to see why it failed

workarounds.action: Verify init container dependencies are available (database, service, config)
workarounds.how: Common pattern: init container waits for a service. Check if the dependency service exists and is reachable

leads_to.condition: when init container loops — pod shows Init:CrashLoopBackOff

preceded_by.condition: when init container image can't be pulled

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Init container failure blocks pod startup entirely, while CrashLoopBackOff occurs after init containers succeed and the main container crashes
